2:Tc56,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Matambre Arrollado","description":"A spectacular Argentine party dish — thin flank steak rolled around a colorful filling of hard-boiled eggs, roasted peppers, olives, and herbs, then braised until tender. Served cold in beautiful pinwheel slices.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/matambre-arrollado.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT45M","cookTime":"PT2M","totalTime":"PT47M","recipeYield":"10 servings","recipeCategory":"main","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"matambre arrollado recipe, argentine rolled flank steak, matambre recipe, argentine party food, cold meat roll argentina","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"320 calories","proteinContent":"28g","carbohydrateContent":"5g","fatContent":"22g"},"recipeIngredient":["Main: 1 matambre (thin flank steak), about 1.5 kg, pounded to even thickness","Main: 3 hard-boiled eggs, halved lengthwise","Main: 2 roasted red bell peppers, cut into strips","Main: 1 large carrot, blanched and cut into strips","Main: 1/2 cup green olives, pitted","Main: 4 cloves garlic, minced","Main: 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped","Main: 1 tbsp dried oregano","Main: Salt and pepper to taste","Main: 1/4 cup red wine vinegar","Braising liquid: 1 cup beef broth","Braising liquid: 1 cup white wine","Braising liquid: 1 onion, quartered","Braising liquid: 2 bay leaves","Braising liquid: Salt and peppercorns"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Lay the matambre flat on a clean surface. Season with salt, pepper, garlic, oregano, and vinegar."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Let marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Arrange the filling in rows along the length of the meat: egg halves, pepper strips, carrot strips, olives."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Sprinkle parsley over the entire surface."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Roll the matambre tightly from the long side, tucking the filling as you go."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Tie securely with kitchen twine at 2-inch intervals. Wrap tightly in cheesecloth or muslin."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Place in a large pot with the braising liquid ingredients. The liquid should cover the roll."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce to low and cook gently for 1.5-2 hours."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"Remove from liquid and let cool for 30 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":10,"text":"While still warm, place a heavy weight on top (a cutting board with cans works) to compress the roll."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":11,"text":"Refrigerate under the weight for at least 4 hours, ideally overnight."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":12,"text":"Remove twine and cheesecloth. Slice into 1cm rounds to reveal the beautiful pinwheel pattern."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":13,"text":"Arrange on a platter and serve at room temperature with chimichurri on the side."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],"$L3","$L4","$L5","$L6"]}],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}

1e:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Matambre literally means 'mata hambre' — 'hunger killer.' It's the thin cut of meat between the hide and the ribs of the cow. In Argentina, matambre arrollado is a traditional cold appetizer served at celebrations, holidays, and family gatherings. The dish showcases the Argentine tradition of turning simple ingredients into something spectacular through patience and skill. Every family has their own filling combination."}]}]]}]
1f:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Refrigerate wrapped in plastic for up to 4 days. Slice cold just before serving. Do not freeze — the texture suffers."}]}]]}]
